definition: black hat (worn by feudal official)/fig. official post
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
lit. to lose one's black hat/to be sacked from an official post

sentences.english: Yan Wang is normally depicted wearing a Chinese judge's cap and sometimes appears on Chinese Hell Bank Notes.
sentences.chinese: 阎王通常戴着一顶乌纱帽，纸钱上也会有他的形象。

sentences.english: If the gender ratio in a region in the province is too high, its leaders will be sacked.
sentences.chinese: 该省性别比例过高的地方，政府领导将被摘掉乌纱帽。

definition: (of an official) to lose one's job
lit. to lose one's black hat/to be sacked from an official post
gauze hat/(fig.) job as an official
cap badge (official sign of rank in Qing dynasty)
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
